text: My husband and i stayed here for a week this June. The hotel apartments are lovely and very modern. They have everything you could want, and it's great to have the best of both worlds - breakfast included as well as self catering facilities.We ate in the restaurant a couple of times. It's good food, but lacks a little atmosphere. Breakfast was okay, could be improved a bit i think.The area is quite quiet, so worth hiring a car to get into Lagos, which is just that little bit too far to walk. You also need one to get to the supermarket, which is a bit of a mission up a big hill!The hotel is right on a beautiful beach, which has a couple of good little eateries. The pool had plenty of space. It was a shame the outdoor pool was too cold for people to use, but useful to have the indoor one.All round great place to stay. If a little quiet, and quite windy!

Where do we start, arrived on the Friday 18th around lunchtime, when we arrived at the hotel we checked in both families rooms(which took an eternity, very laboured and slow) one room was ready immediately, the other room we were told would be ready within an hour. So we went back around an hour and half later and room still not ready, they took my number and said would call before 3pm to let us into the room. 5pm arrives and still no call, so we went back to reception and was told the rooms been ready since 2.30pm. Obviously not best pleased.  We then went to the room and requested an Iron, didn't arrive for 3 days so had no clothes that we could wear, we asked everyday for the iron.The food, what can i say, the options are very limited and basic, meats are dry as a bone, the kids breakfast station consisted of pancakes only, and in the evenings nuggets chips and plain pasta. If you like fruit for breakfast lunch and dinner you will be ok. Food was cold, bland and no flavour.The children's entertainment was again another shocker, the staff didn't even know the words and dances to the songs, we couldn't believe it, very unprofessional. The evening entertainment i think i could have done karaoke better, the mamma mia show they were all miming out of line with the songs and just very very poor.All of the pools were horrifically cold and kids didn't want to swim in them, the indoor heated pool was not included and had to be paid for which booked up so fast as it was so small. Day 2 they ran out of beer which is all we wanted to drink during the day. Snack bar ran out of beer all week and pumps broken and not fixed.The children's pool one of the metal displays was knocked over by a child and the base was left in the pool all sharp and rugged right next to the bottom of the slide. After we complained the lifeguard stuck a table on top of it and it stayed that way all week, absolute disgrace.Day 3 they had workers digging up 3 big holes around the pool area and sectioned off that part of the loungers.All in all this is not a 5 star hotel and i wouldn't even go as far as a 4 star. We have stayed in way better 4 star hotels. Not worth the money do not bother.

We wanted a complete break and found it here. The spa was amazing, nowhere was crowded, we enjoyed finding different places to relax, on the beach, by the infinity pool on the eighth floor, the terraces they all had superb viewsThe decor modern and interesting, lots of green spaces, Enjoyed the buffet meals in a very elegant restaurant

We had a lovely stay here. Very clean hotel, all inclusive, really hard working helpful and harmonious team of staff and hot weather.Our 6 year old had a fantastic holiday and we were happy too - what more could you ask for,The kids club staff work incredibly hard  but so does everyone that i could tell and all with a smile, bar staff, cleaning and maintenance staff, concierge, reception - i could go on.The team all around the hotel are a credit and no doubt contribute to the overall laid back feel of the hotel  which keeps standards high.There was food and drinks available all day and a very wide selection so there should be something for everybody. We enjoyed the themed dinner evenings in the buffet restaurant (american, indian, chinese)Great fun around the pool from scheduled activities to the water slides which were very good. A lot of people stay in this hotel but it never felt TOO crowded - always enough sun loungers for example. The free hourly shuttle to Albufiera (old town) was great and organised well, requiring a ticket from an electronic station.

What an absolutely beautiful setting . Stunning cocktails . So lovely . Very attentive staff and nothing was too much trouble . This is a must visit again . Thanks to Andre the lovely waiter as you were a pleasure . Memory for life x

We travelled as a family group with 3 rooms. We were booked into superior rooms overlooking the pool, but these could not be provided due to C19. However, Victor was so accommodating explaining the situation and the hotel offered to cover our drinks with our DB&B package as compensation.  This more than made up for the switch and our rooms, 301,302 and 302 had stunning views over the terrace to the open sea.  It has to be said Quinta Mirabela must have some of the best views on the Island. The restaurant menu is impressive offering local dishes, lots of fish, and a pasta menu. The restaurant team make your dining experiences so special, with their attention to detail, such friendly manner and can't do enough for you attitude. Marco, Daniel and Nuno are as much an \entertainment team\" as they are restaurant team. We laughed with them all week and they made all of our family feel fully included and special. I can highly recommend the mussels and for something different the scabbard fish with banana!Breakfast is buffet style with hot freshly cooked options
month: including pancakes and omelettes.The location of the hotel is perfect to watch the daily passing of the traditional basket rides
year: the hotel shuttle bus takes you into town and a trip up in the cable car is so worth it.  Our rooms
extracted_date: except for a tea tray but the available from the bar. All were cleaned daily with toiletries and soft towels and dressing gowns.Town is lovely to wander around with lots of outdoor dinning options
year_int: wander the lanes through the old town and admire the door artwork. The market is also worth a visit.We asked Sara and Tanya the reception team to help us with various queries and telephone calls and again this this did with a smile and lovely manner.It just leaves me to say that we would all highly recommend Quinta Mirabela and only wish we had longer!! We will be back - thank you all x"

text: This is a very clean hotel located in a very clean city centre location with everything close by.Staff are very helpful and they explain utilising the various lifts available.Our standard room was spacious, the bathroom was also roomy with a great shower, the C/H was very quiet.The breakfast room was well presented with a choice of hot and cold foods, tea / coffee.There is a rooftop sun lounge area with a bar, loungers, and access to a mid size pool, bar open till 11pm alcohol, tea, coffee snacks etc.Excellent hotel for the price.

Would highly recommend Jupiter. As family of four this hotel provided a great experience and facilities. Food was exceptional, food, drinks and ice cream which kids loved üòä.This was my second year in a row going for October school break and will definitely be back.

Let down badly by poor cleanliness in our room. Shower tray was not touched in the 10days we stayed plus mirror wasn‚Äôt clean and balcony never touched either.Apart from that though everything was great about the hotel and is a great base for a family holiday with nice staff and food. Both a La carte restaurants were exceptional

We had booked a superior room but were upgraded to the suite which was lovely. The bed in the main bedroom was huge and comfortable.Direct access to the gardens and a walk to pool.I enjoyed my swim under the glass covered roof in the rain and the sauna was relaxing.The night we stayed was stormy, windy, rainy, thunder and lightening.  If this is not a very rare occurrence it would be a good idea to fix the windows to stop them rattling.  The noise from this and the rain on the shutters, was loud and our sleep was poor. ( We live in an much older farmhouse and manage to stop the rattles). I mentioned this to the front desk who said they would inform management.Also as suite is under the kitchen or dining room (I'm not sure which) clearing up footsteps go on until about 11.00pm and breakfast preparation starts sometime after 7.00am which spoils the privacy of a luxury suite.Even so we loved our stay, but the superior room might have been better for us.

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: If you only visit one place  in the Porto/ Dourno area this is where you want to stay.  Only 11 rooms, wonderful views , amazing food , very special wine and a very hospitable team.  If you can‚Äôt stay at least go for lunch.One of the highlights was doing wine maker of the day with the Quinta‚Äôs winemaker.

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: My second visit to the Dona Felipa with my dad to play golf.. We stayed in one of the rooms that is due to be refurbished. It was still a great room with everyhing we needed - decent sized bathroom with separate WC which was really handy. Stayed for three nights and played four rounds of golf. Breakfast was superb everyday and we then got picked up by Denis to go to San Lorenzo or Pinheiros Altos (depending on where we were playing). Denis is a great guy who is very friendly (in a genuine way). Very knowledgeable about football especially Portugese and Benfica in particular. His english is better than most english people which heps too! Gave us great recommendations on where to watch the World cup. I'm a big fan of the Dona Felipa and hope to return next year.

We enjoy everything there. The staff is very competent, pleasant and dedicated. Rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable. All activities that we tried (guided city walk, surfing lessons, Fado Experience, Sintra tour), organized by the hotel, was excellent. The hotel, at Rossio station, is perfectly located in Lisbon (close to everything... or to metro/train stations). Fantastic, this hotel made our week in Lisbon a great experience and discovery. Thanks to all the staff.

Not a 5* at all- not much choice of food, stayed here while a group of Spanish stayed who looked down their noses at people and was ignorant making the stay uncomfortable and making there no room in the restaurant and bar at times as there was so many of them. Entertainment some nights was Spanish so I‚Äôm not sure what us English was supposed to do? Also, the bar doesn‚Äôt open until 12 and only had snacks between 4 and 5 so had to go out spending money on food as we got hungry inbetween meal times which is a joke as we‚Äôve paid to be all inclusive. Not only was there hardly any choice of food, but not for drinks either, wasn‚Äôt allowed certain things of the menu had to pay extra for them.Spa room was a good thing to have however it‚Äôs not really hygienic in there. On the first day we complained and they didn‚Äôt want to listen to us and shut us off.  Won‚Äôt be returning.

We arrived late in the afternoon sick of driving, hungry, and needing a drink!  We found the place tucked away on a country lane on the way to Marvao.  We asked for something to eat and Louisa asked what we wanted in our salad! It was made to our liking with fresh fruits and vegetables. Breakfast of local products was good and it wad fun to squeeze our own orange juice! The bed was very firm.

We had two pleasant nights here. The room was very comfortable and well stocked. The pool was lovely. The restaurant was very attractive. The food was very good although not 5 star. This was not a major issue considering the small number of guests and the very reasonable price per night. The staff were very helpful. (We did not play golf!)

The 25 Feb 06 review below pretty much says it all but to add/ reiterate a couple of points.This is fantastic value for a genuine design hotel (minimal rooms, infinity pool, lightbox restaurant,  etc.) in an exceptional location overlooking the Atlantic. Bed & breakfast with a full, elevated, cliff top seaview plus airport transfers for ‚Ç¨83 per room per night is a genuine bargain. By rights, it should be twice the price and were it on an island that had a reputation for a slightly younger clientele, slightly cheaper flights (though GB¬¥s flights were competitive) and perhaps also a better guaranteed sun record, it would.The one reason for there not being a higher quantity of glowing reviews here is. perhaps, that 90% of the guests are German speaking (although English is the first language of the hotel) with the remainder largely Portugeuse.Do note that Ponta do Sol itself has little to divert. Whilst the hotel does offer a range of free transfers to Funchal (20 mins) and for walking the levadas, a hire car is recommended for those staying anything more than a handful of days.The staff are great but not intrusive. The pool honesty bar is beyond reasonable (coffee ‚Ç¨1, beer ‚Ç¨2). The restaurant is above average with a superior breakfast buffet.Altogether, highly recommended.

Found this lovely little place on Tripadvisor. A great find. Paulo and Natercia were welcoming and friendly. Paulo gave advice nowhere to eat,what to do etc. Breakfast just kept coming. Best of all were the delicious cakes that Paulo made, a different one each day. Thoroughly recommend it. Only slight drawback was finding it.

On arrival we realised the place was a hostel as well as a hotel, which wasn't clear when we booked through Secret Escapes.  The reception area was chaotic as it seemed everyone checked in at the same time.  There were 2 young women on duty, who were perfectly pleasant but not very efficient.  To get to our room we had to go back outside, as the hostel is in the main part of the building.  The front door is very heavy and slams if you don't grab it before it closes - this was an issue through the night as pretty much everyone let it slam. As our room was directly above it, we were wakened on a number of occasions. It may be an idea to put a notice on it to let guests know.We were disappointed with our room. We expected it to be quirky, which was why we booked it, but the furniture could do with being better. Our wardrobe screeched every time we opened the doors. Saying that, the room was very clean and the bed exceptionally comfortable.  The shower is outstanding and there was always hot water available. The room was cleaned each day we were there and fresh water left for us.  The television didn't work when we turned it on, so my husband went to reception to ask for help with it.  They never came.  We asked a further twice and no one turned up.The hotel is in a beautiful location with fantastic views across the city.  There is a lovely plaza just across the road and there were various types of musicians there every day and also a caf√©, under an awning if you wanted to sit and have a drink and a pastry.As in previous reviews, our room was at the front of the hotel and the traffic is non stop 24/7, as you'd expect in a busy city.  The windows kept out a lot of the noise but the room was very hot at times so we couldn't have the windows open.  There were no instructions on how to work the heater in the room, or to tell us about wi-fi or even recommendations for what to see, where to eat and transport. That would have been helpful.The wi-fi is woefully inadequate in the side where the hotel is; it may be better in the hostel side.  The password is only available in reception.Breakfast was adequate. There is a buffet which was replenished regularly but if you want a hot breakfast, the choice was pretty much eggs or pancakes.  On the first morning we were pretty much ignored; there were 2 young women but they never approached us to tell us how things worked.  The rest of the stay was better as there was a lovely lady there who was efficient and made things run smoothly. It made us smile to hear her sing her way through breakfast and engage with the guests.There is a rooftop restaurant that only caters for private functions and it is above the rooms in the hotel side, with access through the same front door. There was a function on one of our nights and the noise was ridiculous until 2 in the morning. The front doors were wide open and there was a constant stream of people up and down the stairs, past our room. There is a piano in the lobby, which people were playing. I have no objections to that - just not after midnight! We also had the smell of cigarette smoke as the doors were open all night.  If you are going to have a function suite, it should be separate from the guest bedrooms.I hate writing negative reviews, but all the smaller issues just make it impossible to have a really positive experience.All this being said, we loved Lisbon. It's a vibrant city, with lots to see and do. If you have mobility problems, then the many hills would not suit. However, there is an excellent public transport service, lots of taxis and tuk tuks everywhere.We would highly recommend the Benfica Stadium Tour, if you are a lover of football. Our ticket included access to the museum after the tour.  At 17 Euro's each, it was a bargain. We also went to the Castelo de Sao Jorge.  There isn't a huge amount there but the views from it were amazing and it was lovely to walk around the grounds and find out its history.  We arrived about 11am and it was getting very busy, so I imagine it gets more so as the season goes on. There are lots of boat trips available and we did one that lasted an hour and a half. It was wonderful to see the coast of Lisbon by boat and a very chilled way to do it.There are so many different places to eat and drink, you are spoiled for choice and there are many and varied shops to explore. We had a warm welcome wherever we went.There is so much to see and do, you'd need more than one visit to this wonderful city.

I‚Äôve been to 50+ hostels around the world and this is the most homely and chilled hostel I‚Äôve ever stayed in! I can‚Äôt fault this place, from the amazing breakfast to the adorable pug Lula ready for a cuddle. A great social environment and super easy to meet new people as a solo traveller. Shoutout to Laurie the BBQ king, they‚Äôre not to be missed! Beds are super comfy with privacy curtains and dorms and bathrooms cleaned everyday. The surf instructors are informative and really take the time to correct and perfect your technique. Thanks so much for having me guys, would 100% return without a doubt!

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: The Valverde is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.Fantastic location, beautiful sophisticated decor and incredibly friendly and help staff.Everything about this hotel is top notch.  I literally cannot think of one thing they could improve on.Do not hesitate to book this hotel. We will be back and we will be telling all our friends about this gem.

We have just returned from our second visit to this hotel and I can say we were disappointed.  There has been no updating since we were there last and the room we were given this year was quite poor.  The fridge hardly worked and made loud noises all night.  Staff did look at it for us and promised it had been fixed..... The door simply did not fit anymore so the fridge was constantly working or defrosting itself.  The cooker door also looked like it had been pulled off and they had attempted to stick it back together.  Shower curtain rail fell off every time you used the shower....  However the room was very clean and the staff came in at least once every two days to tidy up and change the towels.  Staff were helpful but did very little to control the large number of groups of teenagers that were staying.  Parties were a nightly thing with empty bottles thrown in the pool and broken glass on the poolside.  This is not a hotel for couples who want a chilled out holiday as advertised.  Location is perfect and with a bit of modernisation this would be a lovely place to stay.  I don't want this to sound too negative however it is wrongly aimed at couples wanting a beach holiday.

Fabulous location however incredibly noisy with up,and coming building projects adjacent to the property.Facade of the building is delightful and the interior very impressive .Bar staff are light on the ground and this is reflected in the service.Breakfast staff are delightful and the breakfast offer is very good.

We were so happy with our stay here and we are quite discerning travelers. It was clean and the staff was warm, kind, attentive. The rooms were huge and well equipped with everything we needed for ourselves and our young children. It also managed to feel private and personal, despite having other guests there. The breakfast was delightful. We would absolutely stay here again!

We visited the cassa mitchell for 10 days in May. Having read the good reviews we were looking forward to it and we were not disappointed.  The whole place is spotless and the lady who owns it can't do enough for you. No need to rush down for a sunbed as there are plenty to go round. There is also a fabulous restaurant next door the solgamba and a nice cafe for breakfast Leo's is facing. Basically everything you need within a couple of minutes walking distance. This really is a little jem and we would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: The beaches photographed on the Belmond Reid‚Äôs website, literally do not exist on the island of Madeira. The images and narrative descriptions way overpromise while the experience under delivers. Furthermore, there was ongoing construction at the spa that was very disruptive on multiple days of our visit that should‚Äôve been disclosed in advance.

The hotel is  not only of easy access but also within walking distance to the city centre of Evora.The rooms are modern, nicely decorated and very clean. The staff is very efficient, helpful and extremely courteous. The restaurant offers excellent food and service in a delightful atmosphere highlighted by a very original interior decoration.

Beautiful Hotel and the best staff we have ever encountered in all are years of travel. We stayed here for two days before moving on to Madeira, then we came back for one night before flying home. The staff here went above what any typical front desk staff does. Our flight was delayed five times and we asked to pay to stay in one room till later since our son has Epilepsy and sitting at an airport for hours was not optimal. They even arranged for transfers to the airport once flight was ready to leave. My son also has severe nut allergies and the staff at breakfast pulled food from the kitchen so he did not have to eat off the buffet and chance cross contamination. I want to Thank all of the staff for helping make our stay amazing!!The rooms were clean and comfortable with cute balconies we had coffee on each morning. Great location, loved the pool and outdoor lounge area and roof top deck.  I had a wonderful massage as well. This is the perfect boutique hotel near everything but very elegant as well.

Very nice location, amazing view but breakfast and service very disappointing.Rooms very nice and cleanhousekeeping twice a dayBreakfast has no originality, Always the same, every day, no change for a whole week

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: I booked this accommodation in early January 2025 to arrive in early July 2025. 6 days before the start of my stay, my booking was cancelled by the hotel via the booking platform, although my payment was already debited from my credit card the day before. Supposedly the hotel is overbooked??? The accommodation did not feel it necessary to get in touch with me personally. I was already on my tour of Portugal at the time and was forced to accept high additional costs in order to be able to start my planned stay in Lagos anyway. I can therefore only advise against booking this hotel.

A little but nice hotel near the Marques de Pombal square. Not exactly in the city center but near the metro, and anyway not too far away from Rossio Square (20-30 minutes on foot).My room was pretty little but very comfortable and clean, and so was the bed. The bathroom had a great shower! the breakfast was very satisfying.Not a luxury hotel, but is definitely worth the price!

Make available what you promote , get a gym get a spa , better variety of dining areas , better food and for less money . Have night time entertainment , teach front desk staff to tell the truth . Only thing good at your hotel is the housekeeping staff and stop hiding behind the ocean view that's  a given by GOD

Do you research first. If possible visit the resort, if not keep up to date with guest reviews, Do not take anything for granted. Whilst in Carvoeiro hire a car and travel the neighbouring resorts and extensive coastline to discover a plethora of beautiful beached and bays, even when you think you have found your perfect location, you may well be surprised to discover even more around the corner... We were and never take anything for granted....

Walking along & ended up getting cornered by a dull man trying to sell us time shares. Didn‚Äôt make this clear to us however, we were enquiring about sight seeing. When we made it clear we weren‚Äôt interested he became angry & very rude and told us to leave.The maintenance staff were also rude when trying to leave the building, looking us up and down when walking down the corridor & just laughed at us and looked at each other when we asked where the lifts were?! Very mature. Also got told he would pay for our taxi back to our hotel as he had took us in a taxi to this place but just got pushed out onto the streets in the blazing heat having to walk back. Avoid at all costs!!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: I stayed here September time it was all exceptional.  I stay in a lot of 5 Star hotels, including some of the other Belmond hotels, and this is one of my favourite's.  I only stayed 4 nights, but next time I will stay longer as there are plenty of excursions and activities you can do if you don't want to just relax.My room was lovely.  I opted for the Original part of the building but if you prefer more modern then the Garden block is more suitable for you.My room was clean, comfortable and balcony gave a beautiful view out onto the ocean.  The 2 swimming pools on the bar area were excellent and there was plenty of sun beds.  One level down onto the Sea deck area, there are plenty more sun beds and one more swimming pool which is fed by the sea.  You can also dive into the sea from there also.  My dinners at the hotel were all excellent.  Williams Restaurant worthy of its Michelin star.  Villa Cipriani was also nice, as was the terrace dinner restaurant.  Breakfast was quite good too.The complimentary extras such as wine tasting one night a week, pilates, aqua fitness and the complimentary shuttle into Funchal during the day time were excellent too.out of the excursions that they can arrange, I did the side car tour, which was wonderful.I used the Spa whilst there, and this was lovely too.I have nothing but praise for this hotel and can't wait to return.

What an amazing stay at Noah Surf House. The staff is top notch. So friendly and really focused on making it the best stay possible. The location is perfect for watching the beautiful sunset each night and wondering through town. Highly recommended!

They say you get what you pay for and this sums up our Crowne Plaza experience.   It was a cheap option so for the money ¬£54 a night B& B via travel republic you can't really grumble too much.  However the setting and the building itself is lovely, the rooms in particular with lovely bathrooms and very comfortable beds.   If only someone took charge of the front of house service it would be fantastic.  There was no visible management of any kind in the hotel and it translated in terrible service.  The dining room staff had no system to managing tables and people would end up helping themself from the waiter station for tea coffee etc at breakfast.  The bar staff were rushed off their feet and service very slow. The reception staff in the main were very helpful bar one. No one was managing  the pool area so getting a bed was impossible as towels were deposited very early or maybe even the night before.  The sunbed cushions were filthy and the beanbags look like a health hazard. The grass area was being dug up so hence our daily visit to the beach - 16 euros for 2 beds for the day but happy to pay it.  One night we took dinner in the restaurant - poor and some items cold as no one was overseeing the buffet dishes.  The hotel was also subject to a mix of clientele.  Unfortunately there were a couple of loud, foul mouthed male groups when we were there.  We wouldn't return.

Lovely hotel set between two small but super beaches.  Quiet location so not for you if you want nightlife and shops.  Scenic walk along the cliffs to Armacao, which is a pleasant little resort.  Rooms are spacious and well-equipped - really good kitchenette area with kettle, fridge, microwave, crockery etc.  Safe costs 2 euros a day.  No hairdryer or iron in the room, but hairdryer available from reception.  Really lovely pool - lots of sunbeds, free pool towels.  Ate in the restaurant twice - a la carte was good, themed buffet every night too.  Was a kids club and activities in the pool for an hour every afternoon.  The staff were very, very helpful indeed.  Spa area and treatments are great. Main gripe was that we booked a room with a sea-view and got a room at the side of the hotel, which was a view of trees with glimpses of water between.  However, this issue was resolved satisfactorily by the reception staff. Used Yellowfish for our transfers from Faro to the hotel - can highly recommend them too.  Local buses to Portimao and Albufeira are fast and cheap, but not particularly regular, so you need to plan carefully, but otherwise are an easy way to get around without a car. We visited both these places and Fieas, The World of Sand at Pera (there is a special bus you can book from the office in town) and this is definitely worth a visit. We would certainly book a Pestana hotel again.

Just returned from a three-night trip. We spent one night in a street-facing basic room which was perfectly OK but would strongly recommend the seaview with terrace room which we had for our other two nights, not just for the view but for the far superior quality of the room. Staff, location and breakfast were all great, would happily return.

Spent a week here lovely clean hotel with pleasant friendly very smart staff, breakfast was amazing loads to choose from fresh ingredients every day. Room very comfy. Bad points not many but a bit of a niggle only one chair to sit on on balcony with 2 of us in the room we had to take it in turns lol coffee machine in room lovely but only allowed 1 cup per day anymore you had to pay 2 euros for each pod go down to Jumbo supermarket in Faro and you can buy 10 for 1euro 59c id call what the hotel was charging a rip off!! Evening food in hotel I would say expensive and not to our taste but that was our opinion, would I go there again probably.

My Partner and I stayed here for 1 week 09.06.2018,The Hotel was clean tidy, the grounds and pool area were well kept, plenty of sunbeds (Sunbeds all decent not the usual damaged dodgy plastic ones that don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t stay up) and the Staff were all pleasant, reception and bar service was very good, We have only ever stopped in one Hotel that has asked for a deposit (√Ç¬£100), This was in Magaluf years ago, so I feared the worse, this was unfounded as no issues at all, No stag / Hen do`s √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú no nosey carrying on in the night, was a couple of groups but very respectful of the families and younger kids. I think as time moves on they will drop the deposit because the hotel does not seek to attracted  the  party groups.The Strip is 15 mins walk if that √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú top of road turn left, to bottom of road turn right √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú easy, plenty of restaurants about, Indian curries seem popular, most of the restaurants have Tourist menus, but seemed better to pick a main off the normal menu.We did walk to the Old town during the day about 1 hour (calling for a pint) but we are blessed with good health √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú if not 6 euros in a taxi (rank to rank).Lack of branded shops around the area if you like the Brands its 11 euros to Albufaria shoppingRecommend a Bar called 33`s √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú great atmosphere massive selection of drinks √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú lucky to watch Portugal v Spain in world cup.Recommend Wander Inn Pub √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú Great Breakfast and Menu √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú Bargain 2 meals 15 EurosHave a good Holiday

Never again it's no 4 star just a 3 it's not for the English the first room smelt of damp and the next one not much better it caters more for Germans not English Tavira is a lovely place shame about hotel it's in need of a refurb and staff not very helpful would never return and would say to all English don't bother it's not worth it we were treated second rate to the Germans not on at all.

After having read a number of reviews that weren√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t very complimentary about the hotel, it was with some trepidation that we entered the √¢‚Ç¨≈ìlions den√¢‚Ç¨¬ù on our arrival.  All I can say is some people must be very hard to please.  Reception couldn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t have been more helpful, porterage was provided taking our luggage and belongings direct to our apartment. Very good service.  The only fault and really we shouldn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t complain, was the room was on the small side.  The room had everything you needed, was cleaned every day, beds changed every day and towels changed regularly.  We have no complaints, thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

date: Juan Carlos Uwrote a review Sep 2025
text: We stayed 3 nights. Our room overlooked an inner courtyard, the shower head had to be adjusted as the safety was not tight, nothing otherworldly.Both the bathroom and the room were good size, both clean. The air conditioning was not noisy so you could sleep well. The parking is next to the hotel and there is a lift, which is appreciated when you walk with several bags.Breakfast was varied.

We were lucky that the hotel we originally booked has a flood and they could not accommodate us so they sent us to this hotel. The hotel is new, very clean and modern. Location is great, on the river bank, few minute walk from all the restaurants and rooms are not very big, but big enough. \action\" on both sides of the river Douro. Breakfast was also very good. Highly recommended hotel."

The Hotel was not far from the airport and the taxi is about 20eur.Hotel is on the main street. Rooms are nice and clean. Hotel has a nice loby, bar and restourant. There is a nice terrase where you can have a morning coffee.Hotel is on a good location if you want to explore the city by foot. Its not far from the metro station but we acctualy didnt use metro at all. Its about 20 min walking to get to the start point of famous Tram 28.Breakfast was nice and there was a variety of food to choose from. We havent had lunch in the hotel since in the city there are so many restourantes to choose from and we were out all day.I would recomend this hotel for business and toursit visits since it is good value for the money and a good location.

Hotel probably the cleanest we‚Äôve ever stayed in,spotless.Comfortable room and bed,bathrobes a great touch.Location for the old town fantastic.All staff wonderful,helpful and friendly.We had a great holiday and we definitely return to this hotel,couldn‚Äôt fault a thing

We (Eilidh and Lewis)  have been here a few times now and recommend it to our friends who are after a really easy going, friendly atmosphere. You really do feel like you're hanging out with mates in your own home. There's always someone knocking about if you need something.It can be boisterous, but usually if you want somewhere to stay that's not got a personality you stay in a boring hotel and don't make eye contact.The area is really nice. There's a supermarket 5 mins walk away. Beach 20 mins walk away. There are nice little bars and fantastic places to eat. Lagos is a real cosy, wee gem.If you're looking for a place to stay where you can kick back and be yourself, then this is the place to go.We'd go back in a heart beat but I'm not sure what the policy is on taking a baby? Anyone? :D

hotel_name: Porto Pal√É¬°cio Hotel by The Editory
text: Typical city centre hotel located on the outskirts of the city.Only interested in taking your money with as little effort as possible on their part. Apart from the actual bedroom everything is an additional excessive cost (e.g.20 euros to use the swimming pool).Room comfortable but very dusty.

Our 5 days in Lagos were amazing, and our stay at Bura was made by the staff. They made us feel like family, and a special mention to Bex for the good advice and taking us out and showing us the beach and epic nightlife! Would recommend 100%

Stayed here for 3 nights in June 08 and got a great deal through Laterooms for approx √Ç¬£65 per night for a double room with breakfast per night!Lovely room with Pool view on top floor which was great.  Rooms are quite luxurious and very spacious - they also have well fitted out bathrooms.  I would request a pool view as some rooms face a busy street or a garage so pool views are quieter! (Garage is a good place to get alcoholic drinks and snacks!)Breakfasts were the best we had on our holiday - everything on offer you could wish for!  Did not eat dinner here so we could not comment.Situation is great - about a 7 minute walk into town centre where there are some nice bars and restaurants - we enjoyed Os Arcos and Bicos ( great local fish).  Irish Bar near bridge was also very good.  Tavira is one of the nicest towns in the Algarve with lovely architecture - a must to see if you are travelling around.Pool was very nice and peaceful - no problems getting sunbeds or parasols.We would stay here again for sure!

hotel_name: Quinta do Morgado - Monte da Eira Apartments
text: Very clean, comfortable & quiet apartment in a nice private complex with a beautiful pool area! The reception staff went above & beyond to make our stay wonderful! Amenities close by with a short drive to historic Tavira. Highly recommended for a short or longer term vacation!

I enjoyed my stay here. The pool is just so clean and beautiful. It was great to have the beach within walking distance from the hotel. The dinner buffet was not what I normally eat so I didn‚Äôt enjoy it. The mattress should definitely be upgraded because my back hurt the entire trip. All in all I would return here for future trips.

My friend and I stayed here early June for 2 nights, we did not check in until after midnight due to our flight being a night flight, this unfortunately meant we had the last room first floor right above the entrance, we was advised on check in that we could change this the next day, however as we was only there for 2 nights we didn‚Äôt see the point.  The room was noisy as you can hear traffic and also the service truck from early morning.  Aside from this the room was good everything you need, although we found pillows too soft, hotel is pleasant with good breakfast and service always lots available and cheery staff, the bar closes at 12 and does not offer a night service which I found odd, location is good and reception staff helpful, overall good stay.

We only spend one night in this hotel and we where extremely unsatisfied with the room cleanliness and safety. First room we checked-in had a open highvoltage power socket next to the bed. The bathroom was smelling very bad. After complaining was given another room. In both rooms the cleanliness was very superficial. Indeed the rooms have been renewed but still a lot of work needs to be done.The breakfast didn't have very fresh products. Juices and coffee were not to enjoy(not a 4 star breakfast).On check-out we where not even asked if everything was fine. Pay and goodbye.

If you're a light sleeper think twice before staying here. They start preparing breakfast before 7 am on top 5th floor with beautiful views but noisy marble floors. Sound eccos throughout the building. We were on the third floor and we're woken up at 7 am by moving chairs and closing of cabinets. Otherwise nice location, clean and friendly staff.

The hotel is located in the citycenter (but take the metro!). There is a stop 300m from the hotel.This is a small apart hotel, ideal for families! There is also  a mcdo in the street.First of all, compliments to the staff, they were all so friendly!We were upgraded to a family flat,it was so big! Two bathrooms, two bedrooms. The room was modern but quite dark, maybe some white thingq or walls will make the room bigger!The breakfast area is really small,and not so cosy. But you can make your own breakfast in your kitchen.
The dancers Yoandry,Nirma,cinder,leyanna and the choreographer and DJ Lauro and the singer Yadira are fantastic! They have provided a great show and their dancers are amazing!!

It is a very nice place, great quality, well located on a pedestrian street.  The rooms are comfortable and the bedding exquisite. The welcome is kind and the decor extremely neat. The problem is that you do not feel very comfortable.... I explain: in the evening you are asked the exact time you want your breakfast and its contents. The next morning it seems difficult to depart from your choices made the day before. So you feel more like a guest, rather than feeling free like home. Likewise when the afternoon takes you to drink coffee, know that it is possible but it will pay.... In short, I think the rules should be reviewed a little. An √† la carte breakfast when we wake up would be appreciated as well as the possibility of having eggs in the plate rather than scrambled. Probably a detail but often it makes a difference.
Perfect service, excellent gastronomy, cozy rooms and a wonderful atmosphere ‚Äì we felt completely comfortable and would love to come back! An absolute recommendation! üòä

Although the hotel is really good, I think it lacks something to be a 5*. The pool area, despite it being mid-August, at 5:30 p.m. it was already shady, and in the room, although the beds are really comfortable and large, they needed a refrigerator, to keep the water cool and to be able to cool off during the central hours of the day, since there was no bar until 5:00 p.m. It is also advisable to have somewhere else to put clothes, since this was limited to some hangers.

Very spacious and well equipped apartment. Although it has already undergone works, it still needs more renovations. Its location is excellent as it is very close to the metro and other transport, allowing you to quickly reach various parts of the city. Friendly and friendly service.

From the warm welcome to the efficient departure process, this hotel is special. The view of the dock and harbour from our room was glorious both day and night. Belem is the loveliest part of Lisbon and you are a short train journey into the city centre (or catch the shuttle bus). Breakfasts are a feast. And you can easily park your car.

Great hotel considering its age.   Spacious rooms and bathrooms.  Beautiful art and furnishings throughout.  Breakfast buffet is really great!  Staff are all friendly and professional.The basement gym has new high quality equipment, it just needs some small towels and water please.The pools are really lovely, but some maintenance is required, the corners have missing tiles and the dome needs cleaning and touch up some paint.

Stayed for 6 nights on May for wedding anniversary.Good for couples (shower glass wall to the bedroom, but there is a curtain).Bring a 3.5mm cable and connect your sound device or cell to the speakers on the room ceiling. Very nice.Unique location, bit far from traditional attractions.Take subway from Vasco da Gama Mall (10 min pleasant walk), after 7 stations, I'll be in the center of action.My suggestion: if you are looking for a modern hotel, stay here, you won't get anything similar in Central Lisbon.The bedroom view in amazing.The spa, where you can use a indoor heated (29Celsius) poll, sauna (with a floor to ceiling window to the river) for free.Good breakfast.Excellent friendly staff (Rahima at front desk was great).Definitively would come back.

We stayed at this hotel as part of  a package vacation.We were on the first floor, our room faced the street. Fortunately, it was off season otherwise the noise would have been brutal. The balcony is pretty much on the street and very small too. Not very useful. It felt very safe.The room was small but comfortable, Excellent bedding, comfortable mattress and pillows. Spotless clean. The bathroom too. Make sure to use the floor mat in the bathroom, the floor is very slippery when wet.Hangers in the closet are placed back to front not side to side, which makes it cumbersome to use.The coffee maker in the room is good enough and the fridge tiny but did the trick. I  used to make tea (with a teabag not the tea provided by the hotel-capsules like the coffee ones)Staff were very helpful and pleasant. They speak good English and were always ready to help.Good breakfast. The breakfast room is small and I imagine it would be crowded during high season. We always found a table and food at 9 AM.Only one coffee machine,  a bit of a line up. Gluten free buns and muffin were available if requested. Individually wrapped and warmed up before serving. The woman attending the breakfast room was very pleasant and helpful. Unfortunately, I had a bad cold and one morning I preferred to have breakfast in the room. She made sure I had my GF bun and muffin for my husband to bring into the room.There is a swimming pool but was a bit cold during our stay so we did not use it. We used the luggage room for a few hours before the transfer to the train station.We were  very comfortable in Rochavau. Thank you Rochavau staff.Will return. Recommended.

Unsurpassed friendliness, efficiency and cordiality of employeesNew Year's Eve with excellent musical entertainmentGood quality dinner menuAffordable supper for the general level of the eventGood quality brunch
